p: Our analysis showed that aggression levels significantly differed between colony pairs with different infection statuses (Kruskal–Wallis rank-sum test: χ 2 = 25.63, df = 2, p-Value < 0.001). For example, pairs displaying a high level of aggression generally involved one worker that was infection free, while the aggression level significantly decreased when both workers were infected ( Figure 4; Supplementary Table S1).
